japanese.description: Busan is the closest major Korean city to Japan. It's an attractive tourist destination that can be reached in just 3 hours by high-speed ferry from Fukuoka.
japanese.history_culture_desc: Experience Busan's cultural heritage with deep historical connections to Japan
japanese.delicious_food_desc: Experience Busan's fresh seafood and Korean traditional cuisine
japanese.easy_travel_desc: Enjoy comfortable Busan travel with Japanese guidance and friendly service
japanese.route_description:
High-speed ferry from Fukuoka to Busan
Fastest and most convenient travel

seasons.title: Busan's Seasons
seasons.spring_desc: Beautiful Busan spring with cherry blossoms in full bloom
seasons.summer_desc: Summer enjoying cool sea and beaches
seasons.fall_desc: Busan's autumn atmosphere painted with autumn leaves
experience.title: Must-Do Experiences in Busan
experience.food_tour_desc: Experience Busan's unique flavors like pork soup, milmyeon, and seed hotteok
experience.beach_activity_desc: Various marine leisure activities at Haeundae and Gwangalli beaches
experience.culture_art_desc: Meet Busan's art and culture at Gamcheon Culture Village and mural alleys
experience.skyline_desc: Sky travel with Busan Air Cruise and Songdo Skywalk
experience.shopping_desc: Shopping and entertainment at Shinsegae Centum City and Lotte Department Store
experience.night_view_desc: Beautiful Busan night view from Gwangandaegyo and Busan Port Bridge
transport.title: Busan Transportation Guide
transport.intro_desc: Busan can be easily moved with various transportation such as subway, bus, and taxi. Special transportation services for Japanese tourists are also provided.
transport.card_desc: Integrated transportation card usable on subway, bus, and taxi
transport.pass24_desc: Transportation pass for unlimited use all day

about.title: About BUSAN
about.description: Busan is Korea's second-largest city and the largest port city.
about.busan_name_explanation: Busan's name originates from the characteristic that the shape of the mountain in the region resembles a cauldron. Like a cauldron that boils many ingredients with bubbling heat and mixes them, it has achieved many cultural exchanges and has become the hub of dynamic 'mixing', making it Korea's best convergence and complex city.
about.global_marine_city: Global Marine City at the Southernmost Tip of the Korean Peninsula
about.global_marine_city_desc: Numerous beaches such as Haeundae and Gwangalli are full of youth and vitality, and future-oriented skyscrapers are rapidly changing the skyline. The ports and piers are lined with enormous amounts of containers and import/export trade goods, and it is growing into a global hub city centered on finance and logistics.
about.history_title: Busan with a History of Great Transformation
about.history_desc: During the Korean War, refugees from various regions protected the peace of the Korean Peninsula with the Nakdong River as a shield and laid the roots of economic growth. Heterogeneous cultures flowing from various places merged and grew into an artistic city where the fragrance of culture and arts bloomed. The streets and performance venues are full of the fragrance of culture and arts, and romantic festivals such as international film festivals and fireworks festivals heat up the city all year round.
about.camellia_desc: The harmony of deep green leaves and deep red flowers depicts the blue sea and the spirit of loving citizens, and the fresh, shining deep green broad-leaved tree represents the youth and enthusiasm of citizens.
about.seagull_desc: The pure white wings and body symbolize the white-clad people. The tenacity of seagulls that persistently fly through the sky along distant sea routes well represents the spirit of Busan citizens, so it was selected as Busan's bird.
about.mackerel_desc: 'Dynamic, Powerful, Speedy' It symbolizes Busan, a marine and fisheries city that constantly leaps toward its goals with strong power that traverses the Pacific Ocean.
about.location_desc: Located at the southeastern tip of the Korean Peninsula, it faces the Korea Strait to the south, and except for the south, it borders Gyeongsangnam-do.
about.location_note1: â†’ Corresponds to mid-latitude in the Northern Hemisphere and mid-longitude in the Eastern Hemisphere.
about.location_note2: â†’ The latitude is similar to Tokyo, Japan, and the longitude is similar to Nagasaki, Japan.
about.location_climate_desc: Belongs to the temperate monsoon climate zone and the continental east coast climate zone. Because it faces the Korea Strait, it is greatly influenced by the ocean, and the characteristics of an oceanic climate are well manifested.
about.location_climate_note: â†’ The temperature difference between summer and winter is not large, and the four seasons change clearly, making it a city suitable for people to live in.
about.location_gateway_desc: Busan is Korea's No. 1 international trade port and has an international airport, serving as a gateway connecting with various countries.
about.location_gateway_note: â†’ It is connected to Japan, including Tokyo, as well as Osaka, Shimonoseki, Fukuoka, and Nagoya.
about.climate_desc: Because it is located at the southeastern tip of the Korean Peninsula, which is the eastern part of the Eurasian continent where East Asian monsoons are dominant, it exhibits a temperate climate with distinct four seasons.
about.spring_desc: Because the spring wind is very strong (average 4.4m/s), the perceived temperature is quite low. In spring, the daily temperature range is very large, and special weather phenomena such as abnormal dryness, yellow dust, and late frost appear.
about.spring_tip: Tip: Many flowers bloom, so bright-toned clothes are recommended!
about.summer_period: Period: Late June ~ Early September / Rainy Season: Late June ~ Early August
about.summer_temp: Average Temperature: 23.9â„ƒ in July / Late July ~ Mid-August Maximum Temperature 32â„ƒ or higher
about.summer_desc: The daily temperature range is very small at 5.3â„ƒ, but it is the season with the most precipitation, with 50-60% of the annual total precipitation falling. Tropical Night: A phenomenon where the minimum temperature is 25â„ƒ or higher even at night.
about.summer_tip: Tip: The maximum temperature is 32â„ƒ or higher and humid, so light clothing is recommended! An umbrella is essential during the rainy season!
about.fall_temp: Average Temperature: 21.8â„ƒ in September, 17â„ƒ in October, sharp temperature drop from November
about.fall_desc: Due to the influence of migratory high pressure, the weather changes periodically, and from September, it begins to cool down in the morning and evening.
about.fall_tip: Tip: It's cool in the morning and evening, so it's recommended to bring a removable outer garment!!
about.winter_period: Period: Late November ~ Late February of the following year
about.winter_desc: The number of days with a daily minimum temperature below 0â„ƒ is 53 days in Busan, which is the least except for Jeju Island. Three Cold, Four Warm: A phenomenon where the northwest monsoon becomes stronger or weaker in cycles of 3-4 days.
about.winter_tip: Tip: It's much colder than Japan, so it's recommended to dress warmly!
about.coast_desc: Busan's coast is a ria coast with severe coastline inlets and outlets, and one of its characteristics is that the constituent materials that form the coast are diverse. There are rocky coasts made only of bedrock and sandy coasts made of sand.
about.rocky_coast_desc: A rocky coast is a coast where the material that forms the coast is bedrock, and sediments such as gravel, sand, and silt cannot be found. It mainly appears on peninsulas, headlands, or the tips of various islands facing the open sea.
about.rocky_coast_example: Example) Most coasts such as Godeumal in Haeundae, Dongbaek Island, Uam Peninsula, Oryukdo, Yeongdo, Janggun Peninsula, Dusong Peninsula, Molun Peninsula, and Gadeok Island
about.sandy_coast_desc: Unlike rocky coasts, sandy coasts are generally composed of beautiful sand.
about.sandy_coast_example: Example) Inner bays such as Songjeong Bay, Suyeong Bay, Busan Bay, Gamcheon Bay, and Dadae Bay, and the estuary coast of the Nakdong River
about.sand_beach: Sand Beach - Coast made of pure sand
about.sand_beach_example: Example) Haeundae Beach, Songjeong Beach, Gwangalli Beach, etc.
about.gravel_beach: Gravel Beach - Coast made of gravel
about.gravel_beach_desc: Although the scale is not large compared to sand beaches, it is characterized by well-shaped round pebbles
about.gravel_beach_example: Example) Dongsam-dong coast in Yeongdo, Gonpo's house coast, the bay between Seungdumal and Sinseondae on Uam Peninsula, etc.
about.mud_beach: Mud Beach - Coast made of mudflats
about.mud_beach_desc: A coast formed by the deposition of fine-grained silt or silty clay transported by the Nakdong River
about.mud_beach_example: Example) The end of the Nakdong River delta, which is the estuary of the Nakdong River
about.scroll_top: Click to go to the top
place.title: Busan Tourist Attractions by Region
place.subtitle: Select your desired region on the map to explore tourist attractions
place.selection_info: Click on regions on the map to select/deselect them.

tag.search_placeholder: e.g., beach, night view, cafe, family trip...
theme.title: Orora Recommended Themes
theme.subtitle: Busan's Representative Tourist Attractions
tip.card_purchase_desc: You can purchase prepaid rechargeable transportation cards at convenience stores (GS25, CU, 7-Eleven, E-Mart24, etc.)
tip.card_usage_desc: After purchasing the card, you can recharge it with cash at convenience stores or subway stations and use it
tip.kakao_bus_desc: Check bus location and arrival time in real-time
tip.kakao_bus_feature: Get off notifications before arriving at your stop
tip.kakao_subway_desc: Set departure and arrival stations for optimal route guidance
tip.kakao_subway_feature: Check bus route and arrival information through KakaoSubway app
tip.kakao_taxi_desc: Reserve taxis in advance for your desired time and location
tip.kakao_taxi_feature_desc: There is a foreigner-only platform k.ride, so you can use Kakao Taxi even without a Korean phone number or Korean card
tip.naver_map_desc: You can easily get various facility information such as nearby restaurants, cafes, and convenience stores through nearby information search
tip.naver_map_feature1: You can save places you want to go by theme, making it convenient to view on the map
tip.naver_map_feature2: It is linked with Naver reservations, so you can also make reservations from Naver Map
tip.kakao_map_desc: The accuracy of real-time public transportation information is high
tip.kakao_map_feature: When you zoom in on the map, you can check the movement of the subway in real time, so you can check information intuitively
tip.visit_busan_pass_facilities: You can use 42 major paid tourist facilities in Busan
tip.visit_busan_pass_facilities_desc: Major tourist facilities: Songdo Marine Cable Car, Haeundae Blue Line Park Beach Train, City Tour Bus tickets, etc.
tip.visit_busan_pass_transport: Transportation card function is also linked to provide convenience for Busan travel
tip.visit_busan_pass_types: It is divided into 2 time-limited types and 2 quantity-limited types
tip.time_limited_desc: A method of freely viewing, entering, and using tourist facilities registered as free affiliates within a limited time without additional costs
tip.quantity_limited_desc: A method of freely using 3 or 5 registered free affiliates
tip.purchase_method_desc: You can purchase on the Visit Busan Pass website or in the Busan Pass app
tip.pickup_location_desc: You can pick up cards at Busan City Official Travel Information Center, Busan Bank designated branches, or kiosks
tip.card_usage: Card Pass: You can receive free tickets or discount benefits by presenting the physical card pass at the ticket office
tip.mobile_usage: Mobile Pass: You can receive free tickets or discount benefits by presenting the mobile pass at the ticket office
tip.remote_waiting_desc: For popular restaurants, you can apply for remote waiting through apps instead of standing in line
tip.real_time_queue: You can check the store entry order in real time for efficient time management
tip.tabling_desc: You can conveniently process from menu ordering to payment through the Tabling app
tip.tabling_feature: You can easily check waiting times, menu information, and reservation availability for each store in the app
tip.catch_table_desc: There is a foreigner-only app, so foreigners can also use it conveniently
tip.catch_table_feature: You can register for remote waiting and check the waiting status in real time for efficient time management
tip.delivery_desc: Reflecting Korea's fast service culture, it is common to receive food within 30 minutes to 1 hour after ordering
tip.late_night_delivery_desc: Late-night food delivery is very active, and there are many restaurants that offer 24-hour delivery
tip.motorcycle_delivery: The motorcycle delivery rider system is very well established
tip.baemin_desc: It has a wide network of affiliates including various restaurants, cafes, and convenience stores
tip.baemin_feature: Non-member foreign card payment is available, so foreigners can also use the service
tip.shuttle_delivery_desc: You can sign up without a Korean phone number and PayPal is available
tip.photobooth_desc: In Korea, four-cut photos have become a 'play culture' beyond simply taking photos, where you create memories with friends or lovers using props and various poses
tip.photobooth_feature1: Natural skin correction or face shape correction functions are the main features rather than excessive correction
tip.photobooth_feature2: Most are 24-hour unmanned self photo booths, so you can use them anytime
tip.photoism_desc: There are many options to choose from according to purpose and preference, such as Photoism Studio, Box, and Colored
tip.photoism_feature: It provides various limited edition frames through active collaborations with famous celebrities
tip.life_four_cuts_desc: It is the original and most popular brand of 'four-cut photos'
tip.life_four_cuts_feature: You can create and use your own frames in the Life Four Cuts app
tip.naver_map_desc: Search for nearby restaurants, cafes, convenience stores and more
tip.naver_map_feature: Save places by category for easy map viewing
tip.kakao_map_desc: High accuracy of real-time public transportation information
tip.kakao_map_feature: View subway movements in real-time by zooming in
tip.pass_desc: Access 42 major paid tourist facilities in Busan
tip.pass_facilities: Major facilities: Songdo Marine Cable Car, Haeundae Blue Line Park Beach Train, City Tour Bus, etc.
tip.pass_transport: Transportation card function included for convenient Busan travel
tip.pass_types: Available in 2 time-limited and 2 quantity-limited types
tip.time_limited_desc: Free access to registered tourist facilities within limited time
tip.quantity_limited_desc: Choose 3 or 5 registered facilities to use freely
tip.purchase_desc: Purchase on Visit Busan Pass website or Busan Pass app
tip.pickup_desc: Pick up cards at Busan Official Travel Information Center, Busan Bank designated branches, or kiosks
tip.card_usage: Card Pass: Show physical card pass at ticket office for free tickets or discounts
tip.mobile_usage: Mobile Pass: Show mobile pass at ticket office for free tickets or discounts
tip.waiting_desc: For popular restaurants, you can apply for remote waiting through apps instead of standing in line
tip.real_time_queue: Check real-time queue status for efficient time management
tip.tabling_desc: Handle menu ordering and payment conveniently through Tabling app
tip.tabling_feature: Check waiting times, menu info, and reservation availability in the app
tip.catch_table_feature: Register for remote waiting and check real-time queue status
tip.delivery_desc: Korean fast service culture - receive food within 30 minutes to 1 hour after ordering
tip.late_night_desc: Late-night food delivery is very active with many 24-hour restaurants available
tip.motorcycle_delivery: Motorcycle delivery rider system is well-established
tip.baemin_desc: Wide network of restaurants, cafes, convenience stores
tip.baemin_feature: Non-member foreign card payment available for foreigners
tip.shuttle_desc: Registration possible without Korean phone number, PayPal available
tip.photobooth_desc: In Korea, four-cut photos have become a 'play culture' beyond just taking photos
tip.natural_editing: Natural skin and face shape correction rather than excessive editing
tip.self_photo_booth: Mostly 24-hour unmanned self photo booths available anytime
tip.photoism_desc: Various options like Photoism Studio, Box, Colored according to purpose and preference
tip.photoism_feature: Active collaborations with celebrities for limited edition frames
tip.life_four_cuts_desc: Original and most popular 'four-cut photo' brand
tip.life_four_cuts_feature: Create your own frames in Life Four Cuts app
place.click_region_desc: Click on regions to check tourist attractions
orora.title: About Orora
orora.vision_content: Orora is a team of five unique members who come together to present diverse ideas and innovative solutions like the aurora that adorns the night sky. Each team member with different strengths and perspectives creates the best synergy when working together toward one goal. Just as the spectrum of light creates a magnificent spectacle, Orora will break stereotypes, explore new possibilities, and create results that exceed expectations.
orora.arata_busan_desc: ARATA BUSAN is not just a simple travel guide. Like the dual meaning of 'ARATA' meaning 'newness' in Japanese and 'ARATTA' meaning 'I understand' in Busan dialect, we want to help Japanese tourists 'newly' discover Busan's hidden charms and provide the moving experience of deep 'understanding'. Beyond ordinary attractions, we help you experience Busan's diverse aspects with all five senses and discover the true charm of Busan. With ARATA BUSAN, you can enjoy unforgettable memories and true emotions in your journey of getting to know Busan anew. Experience the new stories that Busan offers right now with ARATA BUSAN!
